alert.note: Alert for Debeque to Silt Corridor; Grand and Battlement Mesas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 12:06PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Plateau Creek near Cameo affecting Grand and Battlement Mesas and Debeque to Silt Corridor. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. In addition, Vega Reservoir has reached full capacity, utilizing the overflow spillway, which will maintain high flows down Plateau Creek.
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those recreating along or near the creek should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. COZ007-009-020015- /O.CON.KGJT.FL.A.0004.000000T0000Z-000000T0000Z/ /PCCC2.0.MC.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NR/ 1206 PM MDT Wed May 31 2023 ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is possible. * WHERE...Plateau Creek from Collbran to the confluence with the Colorado River near Cameo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, some lowland flooding can be expected along Route 65. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Debeque to Silt Corridor; Grand and Battlement Mesas
